thread.title: Is Hugh Jackman Teasing Classic Wolverine Costume For Logan?
thread.title_full: Is Hugh Jackman Teasing Classic Wolverine Costume For Logan?

author: Jamie Lovett
title: Is Hugh Jackman Teasing Classic Wolverine Costume For Logan?
text:
Is Hugh Jackman Teasing Classic Wolverine Costume For Logan? Jamie Lovett 0 comments 
Hugh Jackman will wrap up his time playing Wolverine in Logan , his third Wolverine solo film since debuting in the role in 2000’s X-Men . With the end near, many fans have speculated as to whether Jackman will finally wear something that looks like a classic Wolverine costume from the Marvel Comics Universe. 
Jackman, intentionally or otherwise, just threw some more fuel on that fire. Jackman tweeted out a photo of a Wolverine action figure that features the classic brown and tan costume. The tweet’s text reads, “THE ORIGINAL.” 
Check it out below: — Hugh Jackman (@RealHughJackman) February 4, 2017 
A quick correction for Mr. Jackman: that is not Wolverine’s original costume. Perhaps he was referencing this as being a representation of the original Wolverine, the one from the comics that existed before he played him, but if it is a reference to the costume then that’s not quite right. 
The original Wolverine costume is the blue and yellow look. Wolverine was drawn in that costume in his very first appearance, though the whiskered max was redesigned when he joined the X-Men. 
The brown and tan costume came later and was designed by iconic X-Men artist John Byrne. Wolverine was Bryne’s favorite X-Men character and he felt like the yellow and blue look was a bit garish for a trained killer like Wolverine. 
While the brown and tan costume was not the original, it is the costume that Wolverine wore for the longest consecutive period of time, so it is an understandable error. Wolverine wore the brown and tan costume all through the 1980s. In the early 1990s, artist Jim Lee “fixed” Wolverine by giving him his original costume back. 
As to whether Jackman is teasing a costume appearance in Logan , probably not. It seems more likely that Jackman came across the old action figure and decided to have a little fun, but you never know for sure. 
How does Wolverine's brown and tan look rank among his other classic costumes? Find out in our countdown of the best Wolverine costumes ever. 
MORE LOGAN : Top 5 Wolverine Costumes / Logan Director Explains Why Xavier Has Hair / Artist For Comics In Logan Trailer Revealed / This Is What Pierce Brosnan Could Look Like As Mr. Sinister / First 40 Minutes Recap And Review / When Logan Takes Place Revealed / How Logan Is Forced To Deal With Parenthood / Logan Director Believes He'll Re-Team With Hugh Jackman / How Old Man Logan Comics Influenced Movie / Why X-23 Will Be The Best Part / Details On Elizabeth Rodriguez's Role / Why Logan Will Probably Wear Classic Wolverine Costume 
Logan takes place in the year 2029, where mutant births have become extremely rare. The defenders of mutant kind, the X-Men, are long gone, and the only remains of them are an old and struggling Charles Xavier and a weary Logan. Logan's vaunted healing factor has slowed, and at times doesn't seem to work at all. When a young mutant needs his help, Logan has to unsheathe his claws once more. His job isn't over yet. 
Logan stars Hugh Jackman (Logan), Boyd Holbrook (Donald Pierce), Patrick Stewart (Charles Xavier), Dafne Keen (Laura Kinney/X-23), Doris Morgado (Maria), Stephen Merchant (Caliban), Elizabeth Rodriguez (Gabriela), and Richard E. Grant (Dr. Zander Rice). James Mangold is directing and helped on the screenplay along with Scott Frank and Michael Green. 
Logan hits theaters on March 3, 2017. Logan 2017
